column4: I have beryl and devilspie in startup list, and when I log in I need beryl to start before devilspie, if not everything gets ugly and I gotta relog. How can I ensure?
Create a shell script that starts both in the correct order, and make that a startup item
Can you give me a hint how? I think I need to have some kind of wait-command for the latter process, if not it just startes to open both at the same time, and whatever is fastest "wins".
